com.apple.audio.units
Class MusicDevice

java.lang.Object
  com.apple.audio.CAObject
      com.apple.audio.units.AudioUnit
          com.apple.audio.units.MusicDevice
public class MusicDevice
extends AudioUnit

The MusicDevice class typically represents a Software Synthesiser. It presents two sets of event API's (MIDI and extended ):

  • the MIDI API's address the device using the standardized MIDI semantics
    MusicDeviceMIDIEvent()
    MusicDeviceSysEx()
  • the extended API's allow more sophisticated control of notes, but would not be available for all MusicDevices (external MIDI devices)
    MusicDeviceStartNote()
    MusicDeviceStopNote()
    AudioUnitSetParameter() (for group control changes...)
Any arbitrary MIDI event should be possible with MusicDeviceMIDIEvent() and MusicDeviceSysEx()

startNote

public int startNote(int inInstrumentID,
                     int inGroupID,
                     int inOffsetSampleFrame,
                     ExtendedNoteParams inParams)
              throws CAException
Starts a note on the specified instrument using the supplied parameters. The identity of the note is returned to allow the program to manipulate the note whilst it is still sounding.

CoreAudio::MusicDeviceStartNote

Parameters:
inInstrumentID - the unique ID for a particular instrument
inGroupID - the group that this particular note will belong too.
inOffsetSampleFrame - can be used to schedule this event at some offset within the currently rendering buffer
inParams - the optional parameters that can be sent to the synthesiser when starting a note.
Returns:
this integer identifies the note instance that the synth has created. It can be passed in to the control and stop methods to alter the note.
Throws:
CAException
